definitions.definition: A yard to the rear of a house or similar residence.
A person's neighborhood, or an area nearby to a person's usual residence or place of work and where the person is likely to go.
An area nearby to a country or other jurisdiction's legal boundaries, particularly an area in which the country feels it has an interest.
A person or device that cuts (in various senses).
definitions.example: a stone cutter; a die cutter

definitions.definition: A single-masted, fore-and-aft rigged, sailing vessel with at least two headsails, and a mast set further aft than that of a sloop.
A foretooth; an incisor.
A heavy-duty motor boat for official use.
A ship's boat, used for transport ship-to-ship or ship-to-shore.
A ball that moves sideways in the air, or off the pitch, because it has been cut.
A cut fastball.
A ten-pence piece. So named because it is the coin most often sharpened by prison inmates to use as a weapon.
A person who practices self-injury.
A surgeon.
An animal yielding inferior meat, with little or no external fat and marbling.
An officer in the exchequer who notes by cutting on the tallies the sums paid.
A ruffian; a bravo; a destroyer.
A kind of soft yellow brick, easily cut, and used for facework.
A light sleigh drawn by one horse.
The prophesied return of Jesus Christ.
The study of the historical development of languages, particularly as manifested in individual words.
The origin and historical development of a word; the derivation.
An account of the origin and historical development of a word as presented in a dictionary or the like.
(law enforcement) Police force, especially a local or regional branch of a national police force.
A syllable used in solfège to represent the seventh note of a major scale.
(mildly) A creative work of low quality (book, art, etc), produced merely to earn a living or for profit, as opposed to serious creative expression.
A stone used to transfer heat from a fire into a vessel of water, so as to heat the contents.
Someone who studies or practises archaeology.
A polygon with nine sides and nine angles; an enneagon
A sweet, especially a small chocolate-covered candy.
A small, spherical savory snack or canapé.
A Christmas cracker.
(usually uncountable) A black, oily, sticky, viscous substance, consisting mainly of hydrocarbons derived from organic materials such as wood, peat, or coal.
Coal tar.
A solid residual byproduct of tobacco smoke.
A sailor, because of the traditional tarpaulin clothes.
Black tar, a form of heroin.
To coat with tar.
To besmirch.
definitions.example: The allegations tarred his name, even though he was found innocent.

definitions.definition: A program for archiving files, common on Unix systems.
A file produced by such a program.
To create a tar archive.
A Persian long-necked, waisted instrument, shared by many cultures and countries in the Middle East and the Caucasus.
A single-headed round frame drum originating in North Africa and the Middle East.
A filmed audition to test the screen-acting ability of a potential actor.
Any of various large nonvenomous snakes of the genus Eunectes, found mainly in northern South America. Their length can grow to as much as 5 m (15 ft).
(by extension) A large penis.
A particular variety of stud poker.
The act of inaugurating, or inducting into office with solemnity; investiture by appropriate ceremonies.
The formal beginning or initiation of any movement, enterprise, event etc.
definitions.example: The inauguration of the new bar was a success, with plenty of discounts.

definitions.definition: A particular variety of Cucurbita pepo, a small marrow/squash.
The edible fruit of this marrow/squash.
To bother, trouble, irritate.
To harass with persistent requests.
To approach to offer one's services as a prostitute, or otherwise make improper proposals.
To import; to signify.
Grievous, severe, exacting.
Inopportune; unseasonable.
Troublesome; vexatious; persistent.
A workshop in which damage to the bodywork of cars is repaired.
A horse used as a pack animal.

A clear, slightly alkaline liquid secreted into the mouth by the salivary glands and mucous glands, consisting of water, mucin, protein, and enzymes. It moistens the mouth, lubricates ingested food, and begins the breakdown of starches.
A type of bread dough leavened with yeast and lactobacilli that produce acids giving a sour taste.
An old-timer, especially in Alaska.
A permanent resident of the territory. Someone who has lived in the Yukon during all four seasons.
Made from sourdough.
A tank, often made of glass, for keeping live fish or other aquatic animals.
A public place where live fish and other aquatic animals are exhibited.
A person who studies or practises technology.
The process where the cells in the body regenerate and repair themselves.
An act of healing, as by a faith healer.
The psychological process of dealing with a problem or problems.
To make better from a disease, wound, etc.; to revive or cure.
definitions.example: This bandage will heal your cut.

definitions.definition: To become better or healthy again.
definitions.example: Bandages allow cuts to heal.

definitions.definition: To reconcile, as a breach or difference; to make whole; to free from guilt.
definitions.example: to heal dissensions

definitions.definition: To hide, conceal, and keep secret, especially for a secret society (such as the masons).
(now especially in the phrase "hele in") To cover or conceal (a seedling, plant, roots, etc).
To choose or accept (a suggestion)
definitions.example: Although I liked your suggestion, I'll go with my original idea.

definitions.definition: To date, to be involved romantically with (someone)
To have sexual relations with (someone)
To correspond or fit well with, to match.
definitions.example: Does this red skirt go with this pink blouse?

definitions.definition: To be pregnant with (a child).
A close-range shot in which the shooter banks the ball off the backboard from a few feet away.
A relatively easy task.
definitions.example: Meeting the numbers will be a layup, if not a slam dunk.

definitions.definition: The state of being laid up.
definitions.example: The ship endured an interminable layup in the harbor lasting nearly a month.

definitions.definition: A track used to store train cars.
definitions.example: The caboose, long decrepit, rested on a forgotten layup just north of the dry riverbed.

definitions.definition: A train car sitting in storage (laid up), often overnight.
definitions.example: Though I knew we shouldn't be there, she pulled me out of the tunnel and into the dark layup, its floors still grubby from the morning commute many hours ago.

definitions.definition: The process of applying alternate layers of a material and a binding agent to form a composite material.
definitions.example: Forgetting to clear the sawdust around his workshop, Payton ended up contaminating the resin-ply matrix with wood particles during his hand layup.

definitions.definition: A type of small fish, Carassius auratus, typically orange-colored.
definitions.example: For the children's fair we'll have a few games they can play, so that each child "wins" a goldfish as a prize.

definitions.definition: A kick for goal after a free kick has been awarded to the kicker and play has stopped.
A shot taken without jumping.
A type of allegorical drama towards the end of the Middle Ages that demonstrates a moral theme such as a character's inner struggle to attain moral enlightenment or salvation
An array of connected solar cells
Sad, discouraged, in low spirits, unhappy, having no hope
definitions.example: Fans must not be downhearted even though we lost.

definitions.definition: Any of various plants with acidic leaves, especially
A drink, consumed especially in the Caribbean around Christmas, made from the flowers of Hibiscus sabdariffa: hibiscus tea.
A brown colour, with a tint of red.
Of a brown colour, with a tint of red. (especially: a sorrel horse)
A room, especially in a hotel, that is designed for two people and has two single beds (sometimes called a twin room) or one double bed.
A delay, as a formal delay in a proceeding.
definitions.example: The lawyer asked for a postponement in the trial so he could spend more time preparing before it began.

definitions.definition: (with object after out) To calculate.
definitions.example: Can you work out 250 × 12 in your head for me?

definitions.definition: To make sense of.
definitions.example: I can't work these instructions out.

definitions.definition: To smooth or perfect.
definitions.example: This is a beta version; we're still working out the kinks.

definitions.definition: To conclude with the correct solution.
definitions.example: These figures just don't work out.

definitions.definition: To succeed; to result in a satisfactory situation.
definitions.example: Are you still seeing John? – No, it didn't work out.

definitions.definition: To exercise.
definitions.example: John won't be here for a while because he is working out.

definitions.definition: To habitually exercise rigorously, especially by lifting weights, in order to increase strength or muscle mass or maintain fitness.
definitions.example: Wow, you're looking good! Do you work out?

definitions.definition: To earn a wage working away from one's farm.
To campaign for an elective office, on one's own behalf, or on behalf of another, particularly by direct contact.
Campaigning for elective office on behalf of oneself or another candidate.
A chilled beer
Coffee, the liquid drink, which was created by steeping grounds in unheated water for hours (usually 12-24 hours) and then filtering out the grounds
A serving of such
A member of the Hindu priestly caste, one of the four varnas or social groups based on occupation in ancient Hindu society.
One who has realized or attempts to realize Brahman, i.e. God or supreme knowledge.
A scholar, teacher, priest, intellectual, researcher, scientist, knowledge-seeker, or knowledge worker.
A member of a social and cultural elite, especially in the New England region of the USA.
A learned person of refined taste and mild manners.
Scholarly.
The passage of a door; a door-shaped entrance into a house or a room.
The practice or sport of shooting arrows with a bow.
A group of archers.
A painting, sculpture, photograph or other artwork or mass-media-reproduced image depicting one or more human figure(s) in a state of near or total undress.
definitions.example: Lexa sent me a nude last week.

definitions.definition: (with article, "the nude") The state of total nudity.
definitions.example: she caught him in the nude

definitions.definition: A color that resembles or evokes bare flesh; a paint, dye, etc. of such color.
Without clothing or other covering of the skin; without clothing on the genitals or female nipples.
definitions.example: Why do you act so prudish whenever you see nude people?

definitions.definition: Characterized by the nudity of people concerned or to whom the described noun is attributed.
definitions.example: 2019 December 19, Elaine McCahill, “I said no to 'Game of Thrones' nude scene, says 'Charlie' actress Sinead Watters”, Irish Independent: Charlie's breakout star Sinead Watters has revealed that she said no to a nude role in Game of Thrones.

definitions.definition: (of clothing, makeup, etc) Of a color (such as beige or tan) that evokes bare flesh.
definitions.example: 2016 June 2, "Company releases nude chest binder line for different skin tones", in the Washington Blade

definitions.definition: Not valid; void.
A baby that is born dead.
Dead at birth.
(by extension) Ignored, without influence, or unsuccessful from the outset; abortive.
An individual skilled in the art of seduction using verbal skills.
definitions.example: She left with him; he must be a true mack.

definitions.definition: To act as pimp; to pander.
To seduce or flirt with.
A raincoat or mackintosh.

An element of a ship's superstructure which places the function of a ship's mast on its exhaust stack, adding the skeletal supporting structure to the smokestack to support the mast's complement of functions.
A fastener or a fastening method that secures parts by bending metal around a joint and squeezing it together, often with a tool that adds indentations to capture the parts.
definitions.example: The strap was held together by a simple metal crimp.

definitions.definition: The natural curliness of wool fibres.
(usually in the plural) Hair that is shaped so it bends back and forth in many short kinks.
A card game.
To press into small ridges or folds, to pleat, to corrugate.
definitions.example: Cornish pasties are crimped during preparation.

definitions.definition: To fasten by bending metal so that it squeezes around the parts to be fastened.
definitions.example: He crimped the wire in place.

definitions.definition: To pinch and hold; to seize.
To style hair into a crimp, to form hair into tight curls, to make it kinky.
To bend or mold leather into shape.
To gash the flesh, e.g. of a raw fish, to make it crisper when cooked.
Easily crumbled; friable; brittle.
Weak; inconsistent; contradictory.
An agent who procures seamen, soldier, etc., especially by decoying, entrapping, impressing, or seducing them.

(specifically) One who infringes sub-section 1 of the Merchant Shipping Act of 1854, applied to a person other than the owner, master, etc., who engages seamen without a license from the Board of Trade.
A keeper of a low lodging house where sailors and emigrants are entrapped and fleeced.
To impress (seamen or soldiers); to entrap, to decoy.
The wife or widow of a duke.
The female ruler of a duchy.
To court or curry favour for political or business advantage; to flatter obsequiously.
Any of several white, often dark backed birds of the family Laridae having long pointed wings and short legs.
The symbol ̼ , which combines under a letter as a sort of accent.
A fan or member of Brighton and Hove Albion Football Club.
(of a forward) To run in the back line rather than concentrate on primary positional duties in open play.
To use a British Seagull outboard.
To work as a non-union casual stevedore.
A light, gentle wind.
definitions.example: The breeze rustled the papers on her desk.

definitions.definition: Any activity that is easy, not testing or difficult.
definitions.example: After studying Latin, Spanish was a breeze.

definitions.definition: Wind blowing across a cricket match, whatever its strength.
Ashes and residue of coal or charcoal, usually from a furnace. See Wikipedia article on Clinker.
An excited or ruffled state of feeling; a flurry of excitement; a disturbance; a quarrel.
definitions.example: The discovery produced a breeze.

definitions.definition: A brief workout for a racehorse.
(usually with along) To move casually, in a carefree manner.
To blow gently.
To take a horse on a light run in order to understand the running characteristics of the horse and to observe it while under motion.
A gadfly; a horsefly; a strong-bodied dipterous insect of the family Tabanidae.
To buzz.
To create or take part in a riot; to raise an uproar or sedition.
definitions.example: The nuclear protesters rioted outside the military base.

definitions.definition: To act in an unrestrained or wanton manner; to indulge in excess of feasting, luxury, etc.
To cause to riot; to throw into a tumult.
To annoy.
A riot.
To harmonize in opinion, statement, or action; to be in unison or concord; to be or become united or consistent; to concur.
definitions.example: all parties agree in the expediency of the law.

definitions.definition: To yield assent; to accede;—followed by to.
definitions.example: to agree to an offer, or to opinion.

definitions.definition: To yield assent to; to approve.
To make a stipulation by way of settling differences or determining a price; to exchange promises; to come to terms or to a common resolve; to promise.
To be conformable; to resemble; to coincide; to correspond.
definitions.example: the picture does not agree with the original; the two scales agree exactly.

definitions.definition: (now always with with) To suit or be adapted in its effects; to do well.
definitions.example: the same food does not agree with every constitution.

definitions.definition: (grammar) To correspond to (another word) in a grammatical category, such as gender, number, case, or person.
definitions.example: In Romanian, the articles, adjectives, pronouns agree in gender, number and case with the noun they refer to.

definitions.definition: To consent to a contract or to an element of a contract.
In harmony.
definitions.example: We are much more agreed on goals than on methods.

definitions.definition: Indicates agreement on the part of the speaker.
definitions.example: Totally agreed!

definitions.definition: A migratory bird that travels between the Arctic and Antarctic, Sterna paradisaea.
One million (1 000 000) watts, abbreviated as MW.
A barrel-shaped microtubule structure found in most animal cells, important in the process of mitosis (nuclear division).
Of or pertaining to wedding and marriage.
Capable, or characteristic, of breeding.
The first, sparse beard growth of an adolescent.
A long, narrow, deep inlet between cliffs.
One blade on a pair of scissors.
Scissors.
(noun adjunct) Used in certain noun phrases to denote a thing resembling the action of scissors, as scissor kick, scissor hold (wrestling), scissor jack.
To cut using, or as if using, scissors.
To excise or expunge something from a text.
definitions.example: The erroneous testimony was scissored from the record.

definitions.definition: To reproduce (text) as an excerpt, copy.
To move something like a pair of scissors, especially the legs.
definitions.example: The runner scissored over the hurdles.

definitions.definition: (sex) To engage in scissoring (tribadism), a sexual act in which two women intertwine their legs and rub their vulvas against each other.
To skate with one foot significantly in front of the other.

(usually construed as plural) A tool used for cutting thin material, consisting of two crossing blades attached at a pivot point in such a way that the blades slide across each other when the handles are closed.
definitions.example: Scissors are used to cut the flowers.

definitions.definition: An attacking move conducted by two players; the player without the ball runs from one side of the ball carrier, behind the ball carrier, and receives a pass from the ball carrier on the other side.
definitions.example: They executed a perfect scissors.

definitions.definition: A method of skating with one foot significantly in front of the other.
An exercise in which the legs are switched back and forth, suggesting the motion of scissors.
A scissors hold.

(rock paper scissors) A hand with the index and middle fingers open (a handshape resembling scissors), that beats paper and is loses to rock. It beats lizard and loses to Spock in rock-paper-scissors-lizard-Spock.
Any of a number of amusing games played indoors with few props by the members of a social gathering.
The use of deliberately nebulous or confusing language.
A thick sauce made from the fat or juices that come out from meat or vegetables as they are being cooked.
A type of gravy.
(Italian-American) Sauce used for pasta.
Curry sauce.
Unearned gain.
Extra benefit.
definitions.example: The first thousand tickets and the concessions cover the venue and the band. The rest is gravy.

definitions.definition: A chubby, plump person
An overweight or obese gay man.
A penile erection, especially when short and with a large circumference; a boner.
Of a person: slightly overweight, somewhat fat, and hence plump, rounded, and soft.
definitions.example: Obviously the chubby child was eating too much.

definitions.definition: Of a body part: containing a moderate amount of fat.
definitions.example: It’s quite normal for babies to have chubby cheeks.

definitions.definition: (sometimes hyphenated) An abandonment, withdrawal from, or softening of a previously expressed opinion, policy, argument, etc.
(sometimes followed by from) To abandon, withdraw from, or soften a previously expressed opinion, argument, etc.
A form of tourism in which tourists stay in farms or agricultural villages, either to experience farm life, or as a base for exploring the countryside

The indirect protection against the spread of a contagious disease in a given population caused by the immunity of a significant proportion of the population to that particular disease; the immunity may have been obtained through having survived the infection or through vaccination.
A cultivar of the peach distinguished by its skin being smooth, not fuzzy.
A nectar-like liquid medicine.
Nectarous; like nectar.
A game show in the form of a quiz
A location where aircraft are operated, usually having a runway and maintenance facilities.
definitions.example: They landed at the airdrome.

definitions.definition: A mass (especially Catholic) to honor and remember a dead person.
A musical composition for such a mass.
A piece of music composed to honor a dead person.
Rest; peace
A large or dangerous shark, specifically, a member of the family Carcharhinidae.
A leader of a group of people, especially an unofficial group.
A person who starts and leads a disturbance (such as a riot), a conspiracy, or a criminal gang.
definitions.example: The police arrested the ringleaders of the smuggling operation.

definitions.definition: The quality of being brothers or brotherly; brotherhood.
A group of people associated for a common purpose.
A social organization of male students at a college or university; usually identified by Greek letters.
An inflamed (raised and colored) spot on the surface of the skin that is usually painful and fills with pus.
definitions.example: I had to pop that embarrassing pimple, it was huge and red and on the tip of my nose.

definitions.definition: An annoying person.
definitions.example: He's such a pimple! I wish he'd stop being so irritating!

definitions.definition: Scotch (whisky)
To develop pimples
Late; especially, past a deadline or too late to fulfill a need.
definitions.example: his library books were three days overdue;  my car is overdue for an oil change;  she finally left on a long overdue vacation

definitions.definition: An oscillating movement.
definitions.example: The wag of my dog's tail expresses happiness.

definitions.definition: A witty person.
To swing from side to side, such as of an animal's tail, or someone's head, to express disagreement or disbelief.
To play truant from school.
To be in action or motion; to move; progress.
To go; to depart.
The bar used to steer a bicycle, motorbike, or similar vehicle, usually used in the plural.
The conduct of a profession, especially medicine or law, as a general practitioner, without a specialty.
A place where a general practitioner works.

A (usually) metal fastener consisting of a cylindrical body that is threaded, with a larger head on one end. It can be inserted into an unthreaded hole up to the head, with a nut then threaded on the other end; a heavy machine screw.
A sliding pin or bar in a lock or latch mechanism.
A bar of wood or metal dropped in horizontal hooks on a door and adjoining wall or between the two sides of a double door, to prevent the door(s) from being forced open.
A sliding mechanism to chamber and unchamber a cartridge in a firearm.
A small personal-armour-piercing missile for short-range use, or (in common usage though deprecated by experts) a short arrow, intended to be shot from a crossbow or a catapult.
A lightning spark, i.e., a lightning bolt.
A sudden event, action or emotion.
definitions.example: The problem's solution struck him like a bolt from the blue.

definitions.definition: A large roll of fabric or similar material, as a bolt of cloth.
definitions.example: 24 March 1774 - Newspaper: Stamford Mercury - "Mr. Cole, Basket-maker...has lost near 300 boults of rods" https//www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000254/17740324/001/0001

definitions.definition: A sudden spring or start; a sudden leap aside.
definitions.example: The horse made a bolt.

definitions.definition: A sudden flight, as to escape creditors.
A refusal to support a nomination made by the party with which one has been connected; a breaking away from one's party.
An iron to fasten the legs of a prisoner; a shackle; a fetter.
A burst of speed or efficiency.
To connect or assemble pieces using a bolt.
definitions.example: Bolt the vice to the bench.

definitions.definition: To secure a door by locking or barring it.
definitions.example: Bolt the door.

definitions.definition: To flee, to depart, to accelerate suddenly.
definitions.example: Seeing the snake, the horse bolted.

definitions.definition: To cause to start or spring forth; to dislodge (an animal being hunted).
definitions.example: to bolt a rabbit

definitions.definition: To strike or fall suddenly like a bolt.
To escape.
Of a plant, to grow quickly; to go to seed.
definitions.example: Lettuce and spinach will bolt as the weather warms up.

definitions.definition: To swallow food without chewing it.
To drink one's drink very quickly; to down a drink.
definitions.example: Come on, everyone, bolt your drinks; I want to go to the next pub!

definitions.definition: To refuse to support a nomination made by a party or caucus with which one has been connected; to break away from a party.
To utter precipitately; to blurt or throw out.
Suddenly; straight; unbendingly.
definitions.example: The soldiers stood bolt upright for inspection.

definitions.definition: A sieve, especially a long fine sieve used in milling for bolting flour and meal; a bolter.
To sift, especially through a cloth.
To sift the bran and germ from wheat flour.
definitions.example: Graham flour is unbolted flour.

definitions.definition: To separate, assort, refine, or purify by other means.
To discuss or argue privately, and for practice, as cases at law.
To evoke an intense interest or attraction in someone.
definitions.example: The flickering TV fascinated the cat.

definitions.definition: To make someone hold motionless; to spellbind.
definitions.example: We were fascinated by the potter's skill.

definitions.definition: To be irresistibly charming or attractive to.
definitions.example: Her gait fascinates all men.

definitions.definition: A plastic with this property.
Softening when heated and hardening when cooled, and thus able to be moulded
A desk, or workstation, used by different employees at different times.
To use different shared desks or workstations at different times.
A person whose job involves climbing tall structures like steeples in order to make repairs.
The earliest period of childhood (crawling rather than walking).
The state of being an infant.
An early stage in the development of anything.
definitions.example: Space tourism is still in its infancy.

definitions.definition: The state of being a minor.
A non-commissioned officer of rank E-7 in the United States Marine Corps, ranking above a staff sergeant and below a master sergeant or first sergeant.
Any mollusc belonging to the taxonomic class Bivalvia, characterized by a shell consisting of two hinged sections, such as a scallop, clam, mussel or oyster.
A pericarp in which the seed case opens or splits into two parts or valves.
A book or other product that has sold in large numbers.
(grammar, of a verb) not transitive: not having, or not taking, a direct object
definitions.example: The word "drink" is a transitive verb in "they drink wine", but an intransitive one in "they drink often."

definitions.definition: Not transitive or passing further; kept; detained
Pajamas/pyjamas
A gun.
An artistic movement and an aesthetic philosophy that aims for the liberation of the mind by emphasizing the critical and imaginative powers of the subconscious.
A vehicle that flies through space.
A finite pattern that reappears after a certain number of generations in the same orientation but in a different position.
The operator <=> in the Perl, PHP and Ruby programming languages, which compares two values and indicates whether the first is lesser than, greater than, or equal to the second.
